item.title: Conventional Loan Pre-Approval: How Brokers Get You Approved Faster
item.description:
In competitive housing markets, pre-approval speed determines whether you win or lose bidding wars. Mortgage brokers accelerate pre-approvals through lender relationships, documentation expertise, and underwriting knowledge that direct lenders can’t match.

Pre-Qualification vs. Pre-Approval: Critical Difference

Pre-qualification: Informal estimate based on self-reported information. Carries no weight with sellers.

Pre-approval: Verified income, assets, and credit with conditional lender commitment. Sellers take these seriously.

Broker advantage: Brokers issue pre-approvals backed by actual lender underwriting, not informal estimates.

item.title: Mortgage Broker vs. Direct Lender: Which Saves You More Money?
item.description:
Should you work with a mortgage broker or apply directly to a bank? This decision impacts your interest rate, closing costs, and overall borrowing experience. Let’s break down the facts so you can choose the right path for your conventional loan.

What Is a Mortgage Broker?

A mortgage broker is a licensed professional who acts as an intermediary between you and multiple lenders. Brokers don’t lend money themselves—they compare loan offers from their network of banks, credit unions, and mortgage companies to find your best match.
